channel.title: BUbreakingSectionTwo
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from BUbreakingSectionTwo, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Michael Bloomberg and Warren Buffett agree on advice to Gen Z: Choose vibes over money in your job search
item.description: Bloomberg took a lower salary for his first job out of school because he preferred the people who interviewed him.

item.title: Why whatever’s happening in Venezuela isn’t ‘regime change’
item.description: Regime change refers to something far more ambitious and far more consequential than plucking out a single leader.

item.title: Google billionaire Larry Page copies the Jeff Bezos playbook, buying a $173 million Miami compound that will save him millions in taxes
item.description: Critics warned a wealth tax in California would lead to a billionaire exodus. Florida says come on in, the water's warm.

item.title: Gov. Gavin Newsom Criticizes Trump in State of the State Address
item.description: Gov. Gavin Newsom criticized President Trump and portrayed his state as “a beacon” of democracy in a State of the State address that suggested nationa...

item.title: Hochul and Mamdani Announce Plan to Make N.Y. Child Care Universal
item.description: Gov. Kathy Hochul and Mayor Zohran Mamdani described a complex and expensive expansion of child care in New York City that would add programs for 2-ye...

item.title: Minn. Officials Say They’re Being Blocked From Investigating Fatal ICE Shooting
item.description: Federal officers fired tear gas to disperse early-morning protesters as outrage mounted in Minneapolis over the killing of a 37-year-old woman in her ...

item.title: Why Trump’s Venezuela strike may have been about Cuba as much as it was about oil
item.description: Nicolas Maduro’s capture has effectively taken away Cuba’s closest ally.

item.title: Venezuela Leaders to Free Political Prisoners in a Sign of Possible Change
item.description: The release, which was expected to happen later on Thursday, offers the first gesture of conciliation under an interim government, even as arrests and...

item.title: Court Records Reveal ICE Agent Jonathan Ross’s Previous Dragging Incident
item.description: The agent who shot a woman in Minneapolis on Wednesday was pulled about 100 yards by a car last year while firing a stun gun at the driver. A cut on h...

item.title: I’m the SolarWinds CEO. Here’s why a $4.4 billion move to go private was right for us
item.description: Looking back, the deal succeeded not because we pushed harder or moved faster, but because we stayed balanced.

item.title: Trump Addresses Venezuela, Greenland and Presidential Power in New York Times Interview
item.description: On topic after topic, President Trump made clear that he would be the arbiter of any limits to his authorities, not international law or treaties.

item.title: Live Updates: Senate Advances Measure to Curb Trump’s Use of Force in Venezuela
